quote: Captain's Log, Stardate 46271.5.   The Enterprise has entered orbit   of Deinonychus Seven. But our   scheduled rendezvous with the   supply ship Biko has been delayed   for another forty-eight hours.
In the meantime, many members of   the crew are taking advantage of   the delay to pursue their own   projects... myself included.
Computer -- stop playback.
Change the clarinet to an oboe.   Continue recording.
Pause program.
Come.

Captain -- we'd like permission   to take the Engineering computer   off-line for a couple of hours.       We've been working on a new   interface that'll allow Data to   act as an emergency back-up in   case of a ship-wide systems   failure.
In theory, my neural network   should be able to sustain key   systems until primary control is   restored.
It sounds like an intriguing   experiment. I'll be very   interested to see the results.       Permission granted.
It's possible we may even be able   to run secondary systems through   Data. Weapons control... sensor   arrays...
Yes. I get the idea, Mister La   Forge. Thank you. Please   proceed.
Computer -- record again from the   first measure.
Computer -- pause program.
Come.
Jean-Luc, I need to talk with you   about "Something for Breakfast."
The play.
Ah... yes... a very intriguing   drama. But I really don't have   the time it would take to learn   a part. And anyway, I'm not much   of an actor...
That's no problem. You wouldn't   be playing one of the leads.
Oh.
It's a very small part. Only two   lines in the whole play.
Really.
You play the butler.
Let me read the play again...   and I'll let you know.
You'll be wonderful, Jean-Luc.   Rehearsal's at one thirty this   afternoon.
Computer -- continue recording.
Enter.
Captain, I am sorry to interrupt,   but I wanted to consult you   regarding the duty roster.
Proceed.
I was hoping we could take   advantage of the Biko's delay by   staging shipwide security drills.   I have planned a tentative   schedule...
Very impressive, Mister Worf.   But we'll be taking on new   personnel at Starbase One-Eighteen   in a few weeks. Surely the drills   can wait until then.
In that case, I will use the time   to perform maintenance checks on   the forward phaser array.
Mister Worf... is there some   reason you're trying to give   yourself more work?
No sir. I simply wished to use   the extra time to...
... Enjoy yourself. You have some   free time. Use it.
Yes, sir. Thank you, sir.
Computer, once more from the top.
What did he say?
The Captain saw fit to release   me from my duties.
You mean, you can go?
I can go.
Saddle up, Father!
Where are we?
Deadwood, South Dakota...   nineteenth century Earth.       The Ancient West.
What is our function here?
You're the Sheriff... and I'm your   deputy.
We are in charge of law   enforcement?
Right.
You wrote this Holodeck program   yourself?
Well... Mister Barclay helped a   little.
I must talk with Mister Barclay...
Geordi... I have noticed that you   have not shaved in several days.   Are you attempting to grow another   beard?
As a matter of fact, I am...       What do you think?
As is the case with many natural   growth processes, it is difficult   to envision the end product based   on an intermediate stage.
You're right -- give it a few more   days.
Okay... I'll need to access your   auxiliary inputs...
One moment.
I have to admit, Data... I never   get used to seeing you like   this...
I do not understand. You are   constantly working on similar   electronic systems, yet their   appearances do not disturb you.
Yeah, well... you're not just   another electronic system.
Thank you, Geordi. Nor are you   just another biological organism.
That should do it. Are you ready?
Yes.       I am establishing computer   link-up...
Interface complete.
Alright... let's see what you can   do...
If I ever find the varmint who   drew this... he'll be sorry he   ever put pen to paper.       I'm ten times uglier than that,   ain't I?
Shut up.
You laugh so much, it's a wonder   flies don't live in your mouth...
You are a very funny man, Senor   Eli...

That's the bad guy. His name's   Eli Hollander -- they call him   "The Butcher of Bozeman." He's   killed twenty-three men.       He's the meanest, toughest   gunslinger in the West. You have   to watch him... He's fast...
So I am here to apprehend him?
If you can.
You are under arrest.
Is that so --
You will come with me.
No, no, no...       Computer -- freeze program.
What is wrong?
That was too easy. It's gotta   be harder to beat the bad guys.   Otherwise, it's no fun.
Oh.
Computer -- increase program   difficulty to Level Four. Go back   to where my father and I first   walked into the saloon.
Come on, Father...
If I ever find the varmint who   drew this... he'll be sorry he   ever put pen to paper.       I'm ten times uglier than that,   ain't I?
Shut up.
You laugh so much, it's a wonder   flies don't take up residence in   your mouth...
You are a very funny man, Senor   Eli...
Where are they going?
They don't want to get hit by the   bullets.
You are under arrest --
He's getting ready to draw.
Well... looks like Sheriff Worf   is here to arrest me. Don't sound   like a very bright idea... does   it?
You have been accused of   committing a homicide.
If you mean murder, then I guess   I'm guilty.
I've killed twenty-three men,   Sheriff... one more ain't gonna   make that much of a difference.
'Course... shootin someone as ugly   as you... could hardly be   considered a crime.
Were you just born that way...   or did your momma marry an   armadillo?
I am beginning to see the appeal   of this program...
Sheriff, look out!
Don't twitch a whisker, Sheriff...       'Less you want a shave.
Okay, boys... time to saddle up.       But first... get their money and   jewelry.
You are a murderer... and a thief.
A man's gotta make a livin.
I suggest you find a new line of   work.
I asked Counselor Troi to join   us. She loves Western stories.
You'll regret this, stranger.
I am now attempting to access the   long range sensor array...
Forward sensor array coming   online... we're getting a clear   scan...
I will perform a routine   maintenance check on the starboard   inertial damping system...
Dampers on-line... maintanence   check in progress... Data, I think   we're on to something here...       Let's see what you can do with   secondary systems. Try   gravitational control...
Initiating gravitational --
Data, what's wrong?
There appears to be an energy   fluctuation in my neural net.       I am disconnecting my interface   to the computer.
Interface deactivated.
You alright?
I have experienced a brief power   surge in my positronic   subprocessor.       But I am fine.
Maybe the interface coding is less   stable than we thought...       Looks like we've got a few hours   of systems analysis before we can   try this again.
Let's check the interface   programming...
What are his rights in this   century? Will there be a trial...   or shall I execute him?
We're supposed to hold him until   the U.S. Marshal comes. Then   he'll take him to Rapid City for   a trial.
Frankly, I don't think I'll be   around that long. Not after my   old man hears about this.
To what "old man" do you refer?
My pa. When he comes to break   me outta this tin can... the   gravedigger'll be working   overtime...
Your pa's no match for Sheriff   Worf.
If your father comes, we will be   ready for him.
He's right.
You're no match for the   Hollanders.
I am sure the three of us can   handle any problems.
Hold on. I was just passing   through town... saw a little   trouble... thought I'd lend a   hand...       But I'm not one of your deputies,   Sheriff.
Counselor... I would appreciate   your support in this matter.
Durango...       I'm called Durango.
Oh... well... Counselor Durango...   perhaps you would consider   becoming a temporary deputy?
For a price....       Five hundred dollars.
Alexander -- we require large   amounts of currency.
Yes sir. I'll go to the bank and   make a withdrawal.
Deanna... how do you know so much   about this period in Earth's   history?
My father used to read me stories   about the Ancient West when I was   a little girl.       I must admit... I've always wanted   to play the part of the   "Mysterious Stranger."
You are just so brave... facing   down that evil man like you did.
Thank you. Ms... ?
Annie, you big galoot.       You best not forget that   tonight...       I'm gonna cook you up a beef   steak... and gooseberry cobbler   for dessert.
Sounds delicious.
I bought special candles for the   table setting... pure beeswax.
I will not have time this evening.   I have a prisoner.
I'll watch him for you, Sheriff.   You two go have a good time.
That is very considerate of you.   But I would be negligent in my   duties if I did not stay.       I am sorry... Ms. Annie.
It's another woman, ain't it?   That floosie down at Miss   Langford's House of Pleasure...
Who... where?
You sure got a way with women,   Sheriff.
Computer -- activate Picard   Mozart trio, Program One.       Play back tracks one, two and   three. Tempo allegro.
Computer -- stop playback!
Computer -- identify musical   composition.
Picard Mozart trio, Program   One.
Let's read through Act Two. From   the beginning...
"Felis catus is your taxonomic nomenclature   An endothermic quadraped, carnivorous... "
Hold it... Wil, what are you   reading?
My lines. Why?
That's not the right dialogue...
Your visual, olfactory, and auditory senses   Contribute to your hunting skill and... "
Wait a second... I recognize   this... It's Data's poetry.
The play's gone. I just keep   getting more poetry...

Well.. the PADDs are functioning   normally...       It seems to be a problem with the   information retrieval net. For   some reason, when you tried to   bring up your play, the computer   accessed Data's literary files.
Geordi, perhaps this problem is   related to our interface   experiment.
We'd better run a Level Two   diagnostic on the computer. See   if the problem has spread to any   other systems...
And I will perform a   self-diagnostic.
Good idea.
You'll let me know if you find   the play?
Yeah... Don't worry, it's in here   somewhere.
We got him...
Where's my boy?
I'm not supposed to be kidnapped   now...       Computer -- freeze program!
Hey!       Computer -- freeze program!
(to figure, re;     Alexander)   You want us to kill him, Senor   Frank?
No...
He's more valuable to us alive.
Feline supplement, one hundred   twenty-seven.
Spot, I have formulated a new   mixture of foods specifically   tailored to your highly selective   tastes.
Puzzling. I find it extremely   difficult to predict what you will   find acceptable.       Perhaps hunger will compel you   to try it again.
Spot, you are disrupting my   ability to work.
You lil' varmint.
The most important thing about   the quick draw is, you've got to   hold your arm loose... like   this...
Now... you try it.
Hell to blazes... I better warn   my pa. We got a regular sharp   shooter here!
Silence.
Worf... Alexander has been gone   for over half an hour. Shouldn't   he be back by now?
Yes... I will go find him.       Watch the prisoner.
So, Mister Hollander... I   understand you've lived a life   of violent crime.       Would you like to discuss your   feelings about it?
What'll it be?
I am looking for my deputy.   Perhaps you have seen him.
Nope.       What'll you have?
Klingon Firewine.
This ain't Kansas City. We don't   got none of that fancy European   stuff here.       Maybe I should bring you a sherry.   That is what they serve over at   Miss Langford's, ain't it?
Howdy, Sheriff.
Commander ... what are you doing   here?
The name is Frank Hollander.
Oh... I see...
What are you smiling at?
Nothing. Nothing at all...   "Mister Hollander."       What is it you want?
My boy.
That is not possible. Your son   is to stand trial for murder.
Well then... maybe we can work   it out. Is there something   you want... in exchange for   my boy?
You have nothing I want.
What about... your deputy?
What about him?
Where is he?
I do not negotiate with criminals.       Your son will stand trial.
Not so fast...
Commander... what are you doing?
I ain't in the mood for games,   Sheriff.
Data... ?
Computer -- freeze program.
Your move, Sheriff.
I wouldn't walk out that door,   Sheriff...
Worf, what's going on?
The Holodeck safeguards are not   functioning. Alexander is in   danger.
My God -- you've been shot.
Computer -- end program.       Troi to Captain Picard.       Troi to Security.
There is a new character in the   program -- Hollander's father.   He looks like Commander Data...
Data?
But it is not Data... I cannot   explain.       I believe he has taken Alexander.
Now ain't that a shame... the poor   Sheriff's been injured...
What's wrong... was my pa a little   too rough on you?
Data... ?
What?
Why would the computer create   Holodeck characters that look like   Data?
Where have they taken my son?
Where is he?
Temper, temper, Sheriff. Pa   wouldn't be too pleased if I came   back all bruised...
Worf, wait...

We've got to remember... the   Holodeck safeguards may be off,   but this is still a program...       If we can get to the end of this   story... the way it was designed   to play out... the program should   automatically terminate.
You are right...       I will begin by speaking to the   people of this town. Perhaps   someone witnessed Alexander's   abduction.
We think our interface experiment   may have caused one of the   computer's core subroutines to   be altered.
When the interface malfunction   occurred, subroutine C-forty-seven   was replaced by elements of my   personal programming.
What does C-forty-seven control?
Library computer access...   replicator selection...   recreational programming... No   critical systems.
That would explain why your music   composition program began playing   "The Slavonic Dances." I have   been analyzing the collected works   of Anton Dvorak.
The same with Doctor Crusher's   play... and with the food   replicators...
The replicators on Decks Four   through Nine have started   producing nothing but cat food.
Cat food?
I have been formulating   nutritional supplements for Spot.
When can you have the problem   corrected?
We are currently attempting to   isolate the corrupted circuit   pathways.       I reckon the process should take   less then two hours.
What did you say?
I said the process would take less   than two hours.
No -- you said "I reckon... "
According to my memory log, I did   not use those words.       Ya'll must be mistaken.
There, Data, You did it again.
Did whut?
Mister La Forge -- perhaps you   should take Mister Data to   Engineering. See if you can find   the problem.
Aye sir.
Can I help you with somethin?
I spoke to several witnesses.   One saw Alexander being abducted   as he was leaving the bank... by   Hollander's men.
We will begin a systematic search   of the town...

Worf... we've got another   problem. I saw Eli shuffling his   cards. He was doing it the way   Data does when he plays poker...       He doesn't just look like Data...   he has Data's abilities. And   his father probably does, as   well...
Howdy, Sheriff.       I came to see my boy.
Remove your weapon.
Take a good look at that gun,   Sheriff... you might see it again   real soon.
Eli?
Pa!
How have they been treating you,   son?
Real bad, Pa. They ain't fed me   since I got here... and the   Sheriff's been roughin me up   somethin fierce.
Don't you worry. The Sheriff will   pay for this.
Who's the stranger?
Don't know... she ain't said her   name. But she's in cahoots with   the Sheriff... and she's mighty   mean with a Winchester.
Sit tight, boy. I'll have you   home in time for supper.
I'll give you one more opportunity   to avoid an ugly situation,   Sheriff. Release my boy.
I have... reconsidered your offer.   I will release your son... in   exchange for my deputy.
I thought you might have a change   of heart...       Meet me in two hours. You be   in front of the saloon... I'll   be in front of the livery station.
Agreed.
Strangers ain't invited.
In every Western I've ever read,   the villains break their word.   We can't trust him.
But we have made an honorable   agreement.

They're not concerned with honor,   Worf. This is the Ancient West.   There's a gunfighter out there   who can shoot with the speed and   accuracy of an android...       And in two hours, he's going to   try to kill you.
Howdy, Commander.
Mister La Forge... what have you   found?
Well... we figure parts of my   memory structure...       ... have been replaced with   information from the computer's   recreational data-base.
Specifically, files relating to   the nineteenth century American   West.
That explains the accent...
That's right, partner.
Is this another result of the   interface experiment?
I'm afraid so. But we've   initiated a progressive memory   purge to restore Data's programming   to its original state.       He should be back to normal in   a few hours.
What about the computer's   recreational data-base?
We've started a memory purge   there, as well. It'll take   another hour... maybe two.
You just sit tight, Commander.   We'll have it fixed up in time   for supper.
Good.
I will be positioned here, at the   Eastern end of the street...
Frank Hollander says he will   approach from this end...
Once he gets to this point, he   will be within range.
Understood.       What about Alexander?
There is a rain barrel in front   of the saloon. It should be   enough to stop the bullets.
You wouldn't believe what I went   through to talk Old Man Newsome   out of his telegraph machine...
Excellent.
Lord knows why I keep riskin my   life for you, Sheriff...
Thank you, Ms. Annie. I am...   in your debt.
How long will the field last?
It is highly unstable. No more   than fifteen seconds.
Let's hope that's enough.
Eli -- down!
Alexander!
Senor Frank!
Don't even think about it.
Go ahead and shoot me.
Do not show your face in this   town again.
Father!
Are you alright?
Yes.
Computer -- end program.
I don't understand this. The   story should be over... what's   left?
Sheriff... Sheriff!
You're as handy with a   shootin'-iron as you are with a   lady's heart!
Computer -- end program!
Captain's Log, Stardate 46278.3.   Both Commander Data and the ship's   computer have been restored to   normal operation. Our rendezvous   with the supply ship Biko has   proceeded as planned.
Father...
After what happened... I guess   you'll never want to go back to   the Ancient West...
The town of Deadwood may face   danger again, Alexander. If they   do... they'll need a Sheriff...   and a deputy.
